definition: to take the lid off/to expose/to unmask
to wear/to put on/to dress/to bore through/to pierce/to perforate/to penetrate/to pass through/to thread

sentences.english: I’ll be debunking these lies and giving you the truth behind them.
sentences.chinese: 我將揭穿這些謊言並且把後面的真相告訴你。

sentences.english: The result is a top 10 list to debunk the myths.
sentences.chinese: 結果形成了一份“十大”名單來揭穿這一祕密。

sentences.english: She told a lie, and he bowled her out.
And yet Hobbes is a great debunker of human pride.
sentences.chinese: 但霍布斯揭穿了人類傲驕的真面目。

sentences.english: Small, wei chi dating, Lin fang deliberately debunk wei dynasty lies in the presence of ai language.
sentences.chinese: 偉志約會小奇，林芳故意在艾語面前揭穿偉志的謊言。

sentences.english: Talk too much, also will expose by the fact and become unmeaning .
sentences.chinese: 講的話再多，也只會被事實的真相給揭穿而無意義。

sentences.english: Facts once again give the lie to the fallacy.
sentences.chinese: 事實再一次揭穿了這一謊言。

sentences.english: His table manners surely give the lie to his claim that he went to a good school.
sentences.chinese: 他的席間舉止揭穿了他聲你上過一所好學校的謊言。

sentences.english: Little did I know, I would be debunking those laws myths pretty soon.
sentences.chinese: 當時我並不知道，很快我就會揭穿這些所謂的規則。

sentences.english: The girl told a lie, and he bowled her down.
sentences.chinese: 這姑娘撒謊，他把她揭穿了。

definition: to expose/to unmask/to see through (a lie etc)
to puncture/to lay bear or expose (lies etc)
to see through something at first glance (idiom)
to expose/to bring to light/to disclose/revelation
see through (a person, scheme, trick etc)
to expose/to unmask/to ferret out/to disclose/disclosure
to lay bare (actual facts, secrets etc)/to reveal
(of a plot etc) to fall through and stand exposed
to leak/to expose (sb's secret)/to spill the beans/to let the cat out of the bag
to puncture/to pierce/(fig.) to destroy (the facade concealing an unpleasant reality)
one word says it all (idiom)/to hit the nail on the head/to be pithy and correct
